title: Outplay potential
body:
{{champion:238}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:64}} 

Am I the only person who feels like to beat these champs you have to put in a lot more effort then the enemy does? I just feel like you have to play alot smarter then them and they can play just kinda willy nilly. Anyone else agree? Im not trying to sound salty/toxic I just think you have to play alot better then they do to beat them.

replies.body:
You're not wrong. Their kits give them a lot more options than others. This allows them to be more creative with their abilities and this outplay people easier. 

But having more options means they can make more mistakes, which you need to punish them for. 

Yasuo's power is all about the enemy minions based on my observation. He needs targets to be very mobile (1v1 doesn't give him many options) and he needs to land his Q twice to proc the knock up. He's all about exploiting a normal means of defense, your own minions.
Dude thats some next level metaphysical thinking. Ty for the yasuo insight, it all makes sense.
Are you being serious or just messing with me?  I can't tell.
Completely serious. The whole "yasuo exploits your defense which is minions" puts his idea in a higher game perspective.
Oh.  Thanks.
upvoted for calm, helpful discourse.

The strength of mostly {{champion:64}} is that you can't choose your fights against him. He fucked up big time? Just ults you and walks away, or ward-dash away. The other ones are more subtle, I think champions like {{champion:131}} , {{champion:11}}  are fine because when they're in melee, they can't really get out (unless there's the one salvator minion you dash to). They stay. The others can usually dash/blink away.{{champion:157}}  is extremely dependant on minions though, but when there are a bunch, he's dashing like there's no tomorrow.

>The strength of mostly {{champion:64}}  is that you can't choose your fights against him. He fucked up big time? Just ults you and walks away, or ward-dash away.

Or just walks away.
You know... having that tier 2 move speed along with all the mobility, utility, and ult.

I agree with most, but I feel Diana doesn't fit into the list.

I'm not saying Yas is easy to play well, just that to beat a well-played yasuo you need to outplay him _hard_ (or counterpick)

I agree. As a Diana main, I don't want to say it's _easy_ to outplay her, but it's definitely _simple_. Dodge Q, win trade.
Furthermore, if you get a Banshee's Veil, you can tank her Q and still block the moonlight debuff.

Dodge directly to the side. Tbh it's almost that simple if they go for a full ranged q. Because of this I have to put a full ranged q to the further left of them so that it goes through them almost like a normal skill shot.

For bonus points, rotate around Diana counterclockwise to make her shot go wide.
After dodging successfully, make sure to type /all DO A BARREL ROLL

I disagree. It's just so easy in lane for Diana to land Qs and they hit so much harder than a lot of other champion's poke, especially considering how much more spammable they are than the poke of many mages.

And then out of lane it's often just a matter of if your team is out visioning the enemy team where you are. If you can see them over a wall and they can't see you, you win the fight, gg. And the sad thing is this is basically gonna happen a lot because even if you have less vision than the enemy team in general if that one spot where you and an enemy are is a spot where you have vision and they don't... they're gonna die. And with there being less wards in total now since preseason... even more likely.

> [{quoted}](name=Cosnirak,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6q13EbA3,comment-id=000a0001,timestamp=2015-12-22T11:26:31.993+0000)
>
> I disagree. It's just so easy in lane for Diana to land Qs and they hit so much harder than a lot of other champion's poke, especially considering how much more spammable they are than the poke of many mages.
> 
> And then out of lane it's often just a matter of if your team is out visioning the enemy team where you are. If you can see them over a wall and they can't see you, you win the fight, gg. And the sad thing is this is basically gonna happen a lot because even if you have less vision than the enemy team in general if that one spot where you and an enemy are is a spot where you have vision and they don't... they're gonna die. And with there being less wards in total now since preseason... even more likely.

I suppose it depends on what Diana is laning against. I've played diana enough to know her play patterns and how her q works, her q fires in a counterclockwise curve. My point about diana is more about her having more obvious weaknesses. Her mana pool is low, she's actually vulnerable to poke* and can't farm properly from range, which exposes her to poke (q to farm will eat her mana fast). Her shield costs a fair amount of mana and is on a fairly long cooldown, which makes poking her down likely possibility

*As in, she can't dash around to avoid all poke without going oom really fast.

I find her immune to poke, but in non obvious ways. Poking her leaves you open to her hitting you back most of the time and you then you just lose to her. Poking her also tends to run most mages out of mana. She farms very well despite being melee thanks to her Q and passive, it just isn't always easy to do. I've watched pros farm on her and they make it look easy to get 100% of the cs even when under heavy harass.

I find her mana unbelievably amazing compared to every other mana using mid lane champion. You don't need to hit anything but Q until going all in or in desperate anti gank tactics and her Q isn't that costly.

> [{quoted}](name=Dar Raksada,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6q13EbA3,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2015-12-21T20:59:18.260+0000)
>
> I agree with most, but I feel Diana doesn't fit into the list.
> 
> I'm not saying Yas is easy to play well, just that to beat a well-played yasuo you need to outplay him _hard_ (or counterpick)

I agree that Diana doesn't fit into the list.... kind of.

She doesn't fit because Zed, Fizz, Lee, and Yas all have S-tier "NOPE" ability. Diana doesn't have that.

However, as someone who used to main Diana, the laning pattern of charging your passive, then R--W-AA--point_blank_Q (with E if needed) for a nifty little ~350+270% AP near-undodgable damage, and then again in 25 seconds when my ult is back up, is pretty ridiculous. Granted then you have no spells, so it's all about dodging whatever your opponent can throw at you after you jump them.

> [{quoted}](name=Hyrum Graff,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6q13EbA3,comment-id=000a0002,timestamp=2015-12-22T21:57:30.482+0000)
>
> I agree that Diana doesn't fit into the list.... kind of.
> 
> She doesn't fit because Zed, Fizz, Lee, and Yas all have S-tier "NOPE" ability. Diana doesn't have that.
> 
> However, as someone who used to main Diana, the laning pattern of charging your passive, then R--W-AA--point_blank_Q (with E if needed) for a nifty little ~350+270% AP near-undodgable damage, and then again in 25 seconds when my ult is back up, is pretty ridiculous. Granted then you have no spells, so it's all about dodging whatever your opponent can throw at you after you jump them.

I never meant to imply she was weak, just different from the rest.

i can only speak for myself but i by no means play will nilly with Yasuo I actually play as precisely as possible with him its just that similar with Zed jumping around with his shadows you have to dash around and jump all over the play to stack well just about everything about Yasuo and to avoid cc because contrary to belief cc will destroy yasuo literally 1 hard cc and yasuo is toast 

setting your self up in good positions to weave your aa's with your q and then hop out 

avoiding situations where i have to waste windwall because i don't have an escape minion and Yasuo is actually quite immobile when hes not in a minion wave  etc

the problem people have to work so hard to beat him is because they wont take 10 minutes to learn how to actually play against him, ive posted about it before on the boards its laughable the amount of times i've beat hard counters to yasuo (yes there are a lot of them :D) because they simply play straight into Yasuo's strengths.

http://s22.postimg.org/6n0w080b5/yasuo.jpg

My problem isn't playing against Yasuo per say. I can trash him with a lot of champs (including non-counter picks). My problem is with how *little* that actually affects him. He's worse than Akali/Katerina. They roam bot, pick up a double kill, and they're back in the game.  Of course, they actually have to pick up the double which requires some modicum of work.
***Yasuo buys shiv.*** No work required. He's practically full build with just 2-3 items because he's a huge ball of *free stats*.

Then there's the matter of actually punishing him. He has a lot of safety nets for a "hyper carry" (I really need to find that red post where they call him that): Passive shield, lots of dashes, resourcesless, wind wall, strong wave clear, low CD Knock-up, his knock-up can zone opponents for just under 1/3 his time in lane (using *minimum values*), and he can ult off ***any*** displacement (not just knock-ups, and not just his own).
But for all his safety nets; he not only punishes opponents extremely hard for making mistakes, he punishes them just for using common concepts (like not spending all lane phase in the side bushes).

When played well, the risk/reward paradigm on Yasuo is broken. That's what makes him so infuriating to play against. He's not impossible to play against. But if he loses, it only means his opponent is ahead (in some cases {Akali} this is genuinely a big deal); if he wins, it means he can roam and hard carry the game.

Parr of the thing with crit scaling it is multiplicative. Sure having 60% is nice, but say you get a critical with what would be about 130ish AD, that would be about a 236 damage critical and Warlords would heal for I think 15% of that which would be about 36 health (10% being 23.6 = 24 and 5% being 11.5 = 12). That's not as frightening as a higher base damage that is consistent when your damage at that point is inconsistent, albeit in a favorable type of inconsistent with it being Yasuo. This was always the big reason why you always built raw damage on ADCs before your crits; crits are meant to be better as the game goes on and the carry's AD goes up.

Shiv was always a first buy on Yas was because of the wave clear option it gave as well as the nice crit and movespeed. And the thing about Yasuo is that crit on him scales much better via his passive, so he can afford to build shiv first and get away with it because it gives him 60% rather than 30%, which is a bad buy for any ADC with less than 170 AD. Therein lies the only issue (not problem, just issue) with Yasuo imo. It's just that his crit scales well to the degree that it goes against what is true for every other champion in the game. I'm not saying it means he's broken, too strong, etc. It's just he, as a champion, fundamentally changes how the statistics of the game work. That is what makes the champion unique however, and changing that changes the champion's identity. 

Just things to consider. If they change anything about Yasuo, it would have to be very carefully done and with a lot of care so as to preserve his identity as that cri-scaling, sexy tune playing renegade swordsman.

{{champion:127}}  
1. throw some Qs
2. press R when they try to R you
3. ????
4. profit
At least she has to get up close enough to hug you to deal damage.
You don't really have to be close to poke with lissandra, you only go in close for the kill.  The range of your q is extended 2x when you shoot it through minions.

> [{quoted}](name=3SheetsTotheWind,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6q13EbA3,comment-id=001500000000,timestamp=2015-12-22T09:28:34.345+0000)
>
> You don't really have to be close to poke with lissandra, you only go in close for the kill.  The range of your q is extended 2x when you shoot it through minions.

The range goes from 725 > 825 when it goes through minions. Even after it shatters it's still not long range.

I don't think it should be called "outplaying" when one champion's kit allows them to easily dodge skillshots, burst, take less damage, etc... Just because they can dodge spells with their three dashes, it doesn't make them better than the Brand who has no mobility and has to hit two spells to stun them.

The problem with Diana is her huge ratio's. Get hit with one Q, which has a 70% AP ratio, you're going to eat 2 Rs, and two balls from Pale Cascade.

So for a little over 365 mana she'll have used her entire spell list to its maximum effect and clubbed you for (75+50%)*2, 250+80%, 200+70%, 210+60%, and 440+120%. Let me put this into (moon)light... Diana was designed to be an AP FIGHTER. Not a full AP assassin.

But all of these champions deserve to be here. If you get hit with one thing, you're doomed. Diana, Yasuo, or Lee hit a Q? Well, you'd best hope they decide that they can't instantly burst you. Because Yasuo will hop right on your dick through minions, Lee will just Kung-Lao flying kick your teeth in, and Diana will pretty much get a free ult on you.

Fizz... All he's gotta do is use his stupidly low fucking cooldown untargetability and burst you, quite literally, within 0.2 seconds. He doesn't even need his Shark, but with it he might not even need to Q you. Just R and E.

Zed... He's a god damn problem. He is so simple that it's easy to tell what he's going to do, but you have nothing you CAN do other than buy one of two items: {{item:3026}} or {{item:3157}} .


For these 5, you gotta put in at least double the work they do in order to come out alive. To say they don't have their weaknesses is wrong:

Zed has a tough lane if you can dodge the shuriken, 

Yasuo is vulnerable to poke, just keep autoing him now and then when he moves in to get a minion.

Diana is so damn susceptible to ganks if she pushes past mid-way in lane, which she does naturally because of her passive.

Fizz players, unfortunately, need our wishes and support that Chemotherapy goes well. Cancer is a terrible thing.

Lee is Lee. He has his weakness. It's his eye-sight and tendency to try for them LC$ B1G PL4YZ.

Different playstyles. Of course there are champs better at 1v1 in lane/jungle but then what about TF? What can be said about fizz being dominate in lane can be said about TF being dominate in side lanes. Outplay potential yes, but all champs are good at particular things.

"Good at everything." Mobility. Hard CC. Objective control. Safe waveclear. Peel. Burst. Picks.
Mundo is overtuned with his numbers. He's not "broken." His kit is fine.
they just overdid it with the damage buffs on his E. It honestly makes no sense to have that spell on a tank.
He offers nothing in terms of utility and he has to get right up in your face to E you, so it's kind of justifiable to have it on him.
His q's slow is an utility.

the fact that his q scales off hp and has a god damn fucking "minimum damage" is stupid as hell, and with that dmg on e and his natural sustain laning against dis guy or fighting him in general is painful.

You know what would happen if it didn't have a minimum damage? It couldn't kill anything. You can't farm with it, finish enemies with it, steal objectives with it, it's useless without a minimum damage. He got indirectly buffed after being directly buffed and became very strong. His kit is balanced. His numbers are not.

> [{quoted}](name=CubedJustice,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6q13EbA3,comment-id=00060000000100020000,timestamp=2015-12-24T06:09:13.841+0000)
>
> You know what would happen if it didn't have a minimum damage? It couldn't kill anything. You can't farm with it, finish enemies with it, steal objectives with it, it's useless without a minimum damage. He got indirectly buffed after being directly buffed and became very strong. His kit is balanced. His numbers are not.

why do u need a minimum dmg of 80 when in rank1 it already deals 15% of target's max hp. is it that u think chunking over one tenth of a lv1 squishy's hp is too little u need to deal more than that?
Nobody tell him.
Heheheh, but can he riftwalk tho.

Yeah, but at the same time it feels so much more satisfying out playing champions such as these.

When I'm playing and win a trade I secretly say in my head "That'll teach you LC$ BIG PLAY$ CHAMPION"
Well I wouldn't call what {{champion:131}} does an "outplay". Q-R-R doesn't exactly require much skill to execute and has similar bullshit level of burst to {{champion:107}} .

I disagree on Diana...

her kit is not versatile at all, is stiff and pretty straightforward. She might feel oppresive but she is not hard to outplay at all
Only Fizz, his kit is the definition of "toxic design". As for Zed/Lee/Yasuo, I feel like people who pick them are counterplaying themselves half the time, so I actually hate getting them on my team.

some champions have way higher outplay potential than others. some other champs have 0. point and click. both have positives and negatives. the higher the skill cap goes the more advantage the outplay champions get.

Well the reason their lives seem easy is because the person playing them probably mains them or is plat and above. They're so good at it that it SEEMS easy. Give these champs to some random silver nabs who main WW/Kayle/Annie, they'll feed until their enemies have diabetes. Only exception is Fizz. An inbred monkey with head trauma can survive lane with him.

Lee Sin's skill is overrated. After 10 games, you can basically be a Lee god.
I havent' played Yas, so I can't really speak that much for him. 
Zed is easy, if you are a conservative player, and not hyperaggresive.

>Lee Sin's skill is overrated. After 10 games, you can basically be a Lee god.

Yep. That's why Riot gets away with citing his exponentially falling win rates as elo/experience goes down when they buff him (sorry, give him "QoL adjustments"). Despite him being powerful enough to single-handedly dictate the jungle meta for most of his existence.

> [{quoted}](name=Transient Bliss,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6q13EbA3,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-12-21T19:10:44.331+0000)
>
> Well the reason their lives seem easy is because the person playing them probably mains them or is plat and above. They're so good at it that it SEEMS easy. Give these champs to some random silver nabs who main WW/Kayle/Annie, they'll feed until their enemies have diabetes. Only exception is Fizz. An inbred monkey with head trauma can survive lane with him.

As a Gold II Fizz main who is also an inbred monkey with head trauma I can confirm this.
They're way too forgiving. You could be winning lane against Fizz and it only takes one mistake for him to kill you and snowball.

I still don't get the yasuo complaints
I never have issues with him as a mid main.
And I still think he's one of the hardest champs to play

> [{quoted}](name=BadmoonBC,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6q13EbA3,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-12-21T18:15:33.226+0000)
>
> I still don't get the yasuo complaints
> I never have issues with him as a mid main.
> And I still think he's one of the hardest champs to play

When they changed the masteries he became op and then they nerfed what was causing it so he is back to normal now. He was a killing and sustaining machine with one of the most versatile kits in the game for a while there. I don't think everyones anger about that has subdued yet and there are still reasons to be pissed about how good his kit is.

They are strong duelists but they contribute overall less to the team as a whole.

Other champs like {{champion:37}} {{champion:57}} and {{champion:113}} have no real "outplay" potential but they are the types of champs that actually win games.
